bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 30 (Tuesday, February 15, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. HIGGINS of New York:H.R. 6731.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8.[Page H1124]

item.name: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Subcommittee

item.title: National Heritage Area Authority Extension Act of 2021

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 230.

item.title: National Heritage Area Authority Extension Act of 2021

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.name: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text: This bill extends the authority of the Department of the Interior to provide assistance for the Niagara Falls National Heritage Area in New York until May 8, 2038.

bill.title: To amend the Consolidated Natural Resources Act of 2008 to extend the authorization of financial assistance with respect to the Niagara Falls National Heritage Area.

item.title: To amend the Consolidated Natural Resources Act of 2008 to extend the authorization of financial assistance with respect to the Niagara Falls National Heritage Area.
To amend the Consolidated Natural Resources Act of 2008 to extend the authorization of financial assistance with respect to the Niagara Falls National Heritage Area.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
